column25: - Bit 5 tells us if it's an I-type instruction (0) or an R-type instruction (1)
- All operations with the same FUNCT3 code will perform the same operation in the ALU
- FUNCT7 will then be further used for small alterations to the source (only notable example right now is SUB vs ADD, as well as SRA vs SRL)
- Notice how SLL and SLLI are slightly different from SRA/SRAI/SRL/SRLI
- Notice the funct7 of immediate logical shifts have a don't care as its first bit
- Notice that signed and unsigned SLT instructions have different opcodes
- JAL and JALR do not have that much in common at first glance
- Branch instructions just differ on FUNCT3
- Branch instructions and ALU instructions share FUNCT3 codes
